title: 3 Ways to Open Command Prompt with Keyboard on Windows

steps.title: Press ⊞ Win+R.
steps.content: Press ⊞ Win + R . This will open the Run window. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Type cmd.
steps.content: Type cmd . This is the code for the Command Prompt. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Press ↵ Enter . This will open a regular Command Prompt window. To open Command Prompt with Administrator privileges , press CTRL + Shift + Enter . Use the arrow key to highlight Yes to allow access, then press Enter . You can now use the Command Prompt .

steps.title: Press the Windows key.
steps.content: Press the Windows key. This is the Windows logo on your keyboard.

steps.title: Type cmd.
steps.content: Type cmd . This will search for the Command Prompt . It should be the first option. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Press ↵ Enter . This will open a regular Command Prompt window. To open Command Prompt with Administrator privileges, press CTRL + Shift + Enter . Use the arrow key to highlight Yes to allow access, then press Enter . You can also shut down or restart your computer using keyboard shortcuts.

steps.title: Press ⊞ Win+X.
steps.content: Press ⊞ Win + X . Pressing the Windows key and X at the same time opens the Power User menu. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Select Command Prompt.
steps.content: Select Command Prompt . Use the arrow keys to navigate to the Command Prompt . [5] X Research source On newer versions of Windows 10, the Command Prompt is replaced by Windows Powershell . If you don't see the Command Prompt, you can select Run instead. Follow the steps to Using the Run Window to access the Command Prompt.

steps.title: Press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Press ↵ Enter . This will open a regular Command Prompt window. If you have access to a mouse, you can also open CMD using navigation.
